alert.note: Alert for Lackawanna; Luzerne (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 06 at 5:11PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Lackawanna and Luzerne. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 508 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. A half inch to one inch of rain has fallen, and another quarter to half inch of rain is possible. - With recent rainfall causing very wet soils, and with more rain falling in urban areas, water from additional rain will run off to cause minor flooding in poor drainage areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Scranton, Wilkes-Barre, Pittston, Old Forge, Moosic, Edwardsville, Luzerne, West Wyoming, Glendale, Kingston, Plains, Taylor, Exeter, Swoyersville, Duryea, West Pittston, Larksville, Forty Fort, Wyoming and Dupont. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
